features.title: High Street Retail Shop

faqSection.title: Frequently Asked Questions About Shop For Sale in Sector 120 Noida
faqSection.description: Get detailed answers to your most pressing questions regarding commercial property investment financing and market trends in Sector 120 Noida.

faqs.question: What is the typical price range for a commercial shop in Sector 120 Noida
faqs.answer: The price of a Shop For Sale in Sector 120 varies widely based on size floor location and project quality. Small lockable kiosks might start from around 25 lakhs while premium ground-floor retail spaces in high-visibility projects can range significantly higher often starting above 75 lakhs to several crores depending on the square footage. Factors like double-height ceilings proximity to the entrance and whether the unit is already pre-leased heavily influence the final price point.

faqs.question: Are there RERA approved commercial projects available in Sector 120
faqs.answer: Yes Sector 120 hosts several commercial developments that are fully RERA registered and compliant. We prioritize listing shops only within projects that adhere to RERA guidelines ensuring that your investment is secure transparent and protected against common real estate risks such as unexpected project delays. Always verify the RERA registration number before finalizing any purchase agreement for complete peace of mind.

faqs.question: What kind of return on investment ROI can I expect from a retail shop here
faqs.answer: Commercial shops in high-traffic sectors like Sector 120 Noida typically offer competitive rental yields often ranging between 6% to 9% annually depending on the specific project and the lease terms secured with the tenant. Beyond rental income investors also benefit from significant capital appreciation due to the rapid growth and urbanization occurring in this part of Noida especially with improved metro connectivity in nearby sectors.

faqs.question: Is Sector 120 suitable for food and beverage F&B businesses
faqs.answer: Absolutely Sector 120 is highly suitable for F&B businesses due to the high density of adjacent residential housing and office complexes providing a massive daytime and nighttime consumer base. Many commercial projects here offer dedicated food courts or F&B zones with necessary infrastructure like plumbing and exhaust systems pre-installed making them ideal for restaurants cafes and cloud kitchens.

faqs.question: What is the process for securing financing or loans for a commercial shop
faqs.answer: Securing financing for a commercial shop involves approaching major banks or NBFCs who offer commercial property loans. Generally banks fund up to 50% to 60% of the total property value. You will need a clean credit history proof of income and the commercial property documents. Our team can connect you with specialized lenders who understand the nuances of the Noida commercial market.

faqs.question: Should I buy a bare shell shop or a fully fitted-out unit in Sector 120
faqs.answer: This depends entirely on your investment strategy. A bare shell Shop For Sale in Sector 120 is cheaper upfront giving you maximum flexibility to design the interior according to specific business needs but requires immediate fit-out capital. A fully fitted-out unit is slightly more expensive but is ready for immediate leasing often reducing the vacancy period and speeding up rental income generation.

faqs.question: How does the location near the FNG Expressway affect commercial values
faqs.answer: Proximity to the FNG Expressway significantly boosts commercial property values as it ensures excellent regional connectivity attracting customers from a wider geographic area including Ghaziabad and Faridabad. This enhanced accessibility increases visibility and footfall making shops near the expressway highly desirable assets that command premium rentals and faster capital appreciation.

faqs.question: What are the common maintenance charges for shops in commercial complexes
faqs.answer: Maintenance charges in Sector 120 commercial complexes typically cover common area electricity security cleaning maintenance of elevators escalators and centralized HVAC systems if applicable. These charges are usually calculated per square foot and payable monthly or quarterly. Investors should budget approximately Rs 15 to Rs 30 per square foot per month depending on the level of amenities provided by the developer.

faqs.question: Are pre-leased shops a better investment option than vacant ones
faqs.answer: Pre-leased shops are generally considered a safer and lower-risk investment because they offer immediate rental income and eliminate the stress of finding the first tenant. While they might be priced at a slight premium they guarantee a stable revenue stream from day one. However vacant shops offer higher potential capital appreciation if the investor manages to secure a high-paying tenant quickly after purchase.

faqs.question: Is freehold or leasehold ownership common for commercial shops in Sector 120 Noida
faqs.answer: Most commercial properties sold by developers in Sector 120 and Noida are offered on a long-term leasehold basis typically 90 to 99 years granted by the Noida Authority. While not freehold this long leasehold period is standard across Noida and is recognized as equivalent to ownership for investment and resale purposes offering high security and tradability in the market.
